parameters.jsonOutput:
{
  "prompt": "Generate  LinkedIn posts which is knowledgeable  and eductaional use this to create post  topic:{{ $('When Executed by AnotherWorkflow').item.json.topic }} and content:{{ $('When Executed by Another Workflow').item.json.summary }}  ",
  "description": "A high-trust educational professional insight. Ideal for sharing something detailed and insight ful on‚Äîwith a soft tie-in to your values or company‚Äôs mission. main focus on provide knowledge or eductional insight for a given topic",
  "rules": {
    "tone": "Professional, helpful,educational not sales-focused, positive tone",
    "format": "250-300 words, short sentences, 1-2 sentence paragraphs dont form, don't form large paragraphs",
    "structure": "Hook ‚ÜíMain body (explaination) -> insight ‚Üí Takeaway ‚Üí brand mention ‚Üí CTA"
  },
  "hook": "Write a calm, educational LinkedIn hook that starts with a common belief in [topic], then gently shifts to a clearer, more effective perspective.this get people hooked for rest the post",
  "hooks_example": [
    "I used to think [belief] too, until I discovered this:",
    "After [X years] in [field], I've learned [wisdom] is backwards:",
    "Stop doing [practice]. Here's what's working now:",
    "Unpopular but useful: [view]. Here's what I've seen:",
    "I wish someone had told me this about [topic] earlier:"
  ],
  "main": " This provides quick background on the trend, introduces its origin, and shows that a credible figure coined the term‚Äîbuilding curiosity and trust.this part what,why and how",
  "main_expl": [
    "explain what is it",
    "why its ",
    "how its is ",
    "Here‚Äôs a lesson that stuck with me:"
  ],
  "insights": "These express the core message of the post: clarifies the core idea‚Äîtransforming how we think about  helps readers visualize how this shift works.includes stats",
  "insights_example": [
    "Simplicity scales better than complexity.",
    "The tools don‚Äôt matter as much as how people use them.",
    "Clarity is more powerful than control.",
    "Real change starts with small shifts, not giant leaps.",
    "Market Adoption: 44% of developers have already adopted AI coding tools, with adoption accelerating monthly\n\nThe Real Impact:\nStartups are shrinking development teams from 50+ engineers to 5-10 core architects.."
  ],

  "ctas": [
    "What's your take on this?",
    "Have you seen this shift too?",
    "How does this match your experience?",
    "Is this happening in your industry?",
    "Curious about your thoughts?",
    "Save this if it's helpful.",
    "Tag someone who needs to see this.",
    "Share with your network.",
    "Follow for more AI insights.",
    "Connect to stay updated."
  ],
  "workflow": [
    "1. based on given  topic from focus areas",
    "2. explain topic",
    "3. give insights",
    "4. Add evidence/example",
    "5. Include natural Sastha mention",
    "6. End with appropriate CTA"
  ],
  "quality_check": [
    "Specific, not generic?",
    "Easy to understand?",
    "Genuinely helpful?",
    "Contrarian view is insightful?",
    "Sastha AI mention feels natural?",
    "Optimistic and solution-focused?",
    "Relevant to current trends?",
    "Also the post should be relatable and not too hard to understand as we are targeting people who might and might not familiar with all the terms so try not to use technical acronyms"
  ],
  "example_post": "A non-technical founder just raised $2M with an MVP she built herself in a weekend. Welcome to the vibe coding revolution \n Why Vibe Coding is Taking Over Software Development in 2025\n Remember when coding meant wrestling with syntax errors at 2 AM? Those days are rapidly becoming history.\n What is Vibe Coding?\nCoined by AI visionary Andrej Karpathy earlier this year, vibe coding represents a fundamental shift in how we build software. Instead of writing code line by line, developers now describe what they want in plain English, and AI transforms those intentions into working applications.\n Think of it as having a conversation with your computer:\n Build me a social media dashboard that tracks engagement metrics\" ‚Üí and the code just appears.\n Why It's Exploding Right Now:\nüîπ Accessibility Revolution: Non-technical professionals can now build functional software, democratizing development like never before\nüîπ Efficiency Multiplier: Y Combinator's Garry Tan notes that vibe coding allows 10 engineers to do the work of 100, transforming startup economics\nüîπ Perfect Timing: AI tools like Cursor, Replit Agent, and Windsurf have matured beyond simple autocomplete to full end-to-end development\nüîπ Market Adoption: 44% of developers have already adopted AI coding tools, with adoption accelerating monthly\n The Real Impact:\nStartups are shrinking development teams from 50+ engineers to 5-10 core architects. Students and kids are building complex applications that previously required computer science degrees. The barrier between having an idea and making it real has never been lower.\n Is This Just Hype?\nWhile skeptics question sustainability, the numbers don't lie. This isn't about replacing developers‚Äîit's about amplifying human creativity and removing technical friction from innovation.\n The future of software isn't about who can write the most elegant loops. It's about who can best articulate problems and solutions.\n What do you think? Are you experimenting with vibe coding in your projects?\n #VibeCoding #AI #SoftwareDevelopment #Innovation #TechTrends #Automation #StartupLife"

}

{
  "prompt": "Write a LinkedIn post designed to spark discussion and engagement.The post should:- Start with a bold, relatable, or thought-provoking statement.Include a short personal insight, opinion, or observation (2‚Äì3 lines).  - End with an open-ended question to invite comments.  follow give instruction this should be related sastha ai",
  
  "description": "Prompt meaningful discussion through relatable, reflective questions. Ideal for drawing out stories, opinions, tools, or lessons‚Äîwhile grounding the conversation in real experience. that get engagement from user and start a dsicussion",

  "rules": {
    "tone": "Curious, dicussion starting,get people talking ",
    "format": "150‚Äì250 words, short paragraphs, 1‚Äì2 sentences each",
    "structure": "Hook ‚Üí Question setup ‚Üí Brief personal answer ‚Üí Elaboration ‚Üí Invitation ‚Üí Engagement amplifier (optional) ‚Üí CTA"
  },

  "hook":"make a exciting bold hook that can get people engaged and get a discussion going",
  
    "hooks_example": [

      "Hot take: What‚Äôs overrated in [industry]?",
      "Reality check: What‚Äôs harder than people think in [context]?"
    ],
  
 "main":"make a interesting discussion that can get people interested ",

  "main_expl": [

    "It clicked for me after [event]",
    "This came up while navigating [challenge]",
    "A mentor once asked me this, and it stuck",

  "insights":" An insight is a short, valuable takeaway, opinion, or reflection you‚Äôve gained from your own experience ‚Äî something that shows your unique perspective.",
  
  "insights_example":
  [

    "The real shift came when I stopped doing [thing]",

    "The best tool is the one that fits your rhythm",

  ],


  "ctas": [

    "Drop your answer in the comments.",
    "Tag someone who should chime in."
  ],

   "example_post": {
    "topic": "Productivity Tools for Remote Creatives",
    "full_post": "Quick question for my fellow remote creatives: what's your favorite productivity app?\n Personally, I think Notion is a game-changer. I discovered it when juggling multiple clients and content projects‚Äîand it saved me during a messy launch sprint.\n I've tried Trello, Evernote, even handwritten lists. But Notion actually works with the way I think. It helps me zoom out and still track tiny details.\n This ties into something we talk about often at Sastha AI‚Äîhow the right tools don't just organize work, they unlock momentum.\n What about you? Looking for tools I might‚Äôve missed.\n Drop your thoughts in the comments! üí¨"
  }

}

  "example_post": "Everyone says more channels = better support. Here‚Äôs why smart voice AI is the missing link‚Ä¶ üëá\n\nOver the past few years, voice AI has evolved from novelty to necessity.\nCoined by voice-tech pioneers like PolyAI, it enables systems to understand context and converse naturally.\n\nüó£Ô∏è What it is: An AI assistant that uses NLP to drive human-like, multi-language conversations.\nüåç Why it matters: It works 24/7, reduces wait times, and scales globally.\n‚öôÔ∏è How it works: CRM integration + intent recognition + adaptive voice = seamless, personalized support.\n\nüìå A lesson that stuck:\nA hotel chain saw a 65% cost reduction and instant multilingual support after switching to voice AI.\nüé∞ Golden Nugget deployed a voice agent that now handles 34% of calls‚Äîsaving 3+ agent-days weekly.\n\nüí° Real change doesn‚Äôt come from adding more tools.\nIt comes from intelligent, voice-first automation that feels human.\nAI handles the routine. {
  "prompt": " make Case Study & Testimonial based linkedin post  how their product or service helped a client use 'get profile' tool to get know what thet offer make a post about using that including different product and services they have",
  "description": "A concise, high‚Äëimpact post showcasing a real client success story, backed by data and a direct testimonial. Ideal for demonstrating value through concrete results.",
  "rules": {
    "tone": "Professional confidence. Clear, credible, results‚Äëfocused",
    "format": "200‚Äì250 words, short sentences, 1‚Äì2 sentence paragraphs",
    "structure":"HOOK >context>story>branc intrgration>ctas"
   
  },
  "hook": "this get people hooked to tell story of how sastha ai helped a client with available service/product how improved",
  
 "hooks_example": [
    "{Choose one: ‚ÄúHow we cut costs by 30% in 6 weeks.‚Äù, ‚ÄúSee how a small tweak drove big results.‚Äù, ‚ÄúFrom stalled to soaring: a quick turnaround story.‚Äù, etc.}",
    "{Client Name} is a {industry} company facing {broad problem or goal}.",
    "We implemented {tool/process/AI solution}, focusing on {key feature or approach}."
 ],

  "main":"this part should explain how sastha helped a client",

 "main_expl":[
    "We guided their team through {change management step or methodology}.",
     "{Client Name} is a {industry} company facing {broad problem or goal}.",
    "Before working with us, they struggled with {specific obstacle or metric}.",
    " {Metric #1‚Äîe.g., ‚ÄúRevenue up 25% in 3 months.‚Äù}",
    "{Metric #2‚Äîe.g., ‚ÄúSupport tickets down 40%.‚Äù}",
    " {Bonus qualitative outcome‚Äîe.g., ‚ÄúTeam morale improved.‚Äù}"
  ],

  
  "insights": "this show stats and how sastha helped a client also which service or product did that",
  
  "insights_example":[
    "‚Äú{Direct client quote highlighting impact, credibility, and experience.}‚Äù",
    "‚Äì {Client Name, Title, Company}"
  ],
  
 
  "ctas": [
    "Curious how this could work for you? Let‚Äôs chat.",
    "Want proof points for your board? Send me a message.",
    "Ready to see similar results? Book a quick call.",
    "Have a success story of your own? Share it below.",
    "Interested in diving deeper? I‚Äôm here to connect."
  ],


  "example_post": [
    " we‚Äôve been running this factory for 30 years. We don‚Äôt need AI.\n\nThat‚Äôs what the manufacturing VP told me some months back.\n\nWhy?\n\nBecause their last automation system cost $200K and never integrated properly.\n\nSo, I offered him something low-risk: One month of automated supplier communication trials.\n\nMy proposition was simple:\n\nIf my AI handles 100+ vendor inquiries without errors‚Ä¶\nAnd if you see real time savings in your procurement team‚Ä¶\n\nThen, you invest in the full workflow automation.\n\nHesitantly, he said okay!\n\nBut guess what?\n\nWeek 1: AI confused order specifications.\nWeek 2: Vendors complained about \"talking to a robot.\"\nMonth end felt like a complete disaster.\n\nSo, I decided to cut my losses.\n(Honestly, I questioned if manufacturing was ready for this.)\n\nThen last month, I got a call from him:\n\n\"We need to discuss expanding that AI system.\"\n\nI asked \"Why? Your team hated it and vendors were frustrated.\"\n\nHe said:\n\n\"Actually, it processed 347 inquiries we normally take 3 days to handle.\n\nMy procurement team finished their backlog for the first time in years!!\n\nAnd our response time to vendors improved by almost 60%.\"\n\nThis conversation happened last month and I still cannot stop thinking about it.\n\nThe lesson? Sometimes resistance masks the real impact.\n\nPS: What manual process in your operation could use a 60% speed boost?\n\nSend me a DM or let me know in the comments."
  ]
}

    "insights": [

    ],


    
  

    "ctas": [

    "example_post":" Some clarity came from an unexpected place last week.\n\nAfter 6 weeks building a project I was excited about, I shut it down. Not because it failed. But because it no longer felt aligned.\n\nThe hardest part? It was getting traction. People were signing up. But something felt off‚Äîlike I was solving the wrong problem, or building it for the wrong reasons.\n\nSo I paused. Asked myself: \"If this works, will I actually want to keep doing it?\"\n\nThe answer was no.\n\nLetting go felt like a failure‚Äîfor about 48 hours. Then came relief. Then clarity. Within days, that same energy went into something more meaningful and aligned with where I‚Äôm heading.\n\nIt reminded me that momentum isn‚Äôt always a green light. Sometimes we keep building because we *can*, not because we *should*.\n\nAnd this shows up everywhere‚Äîstartups, AI projects, leadership decisions. in my Sastha AI journey, we see it in companies overbuilding, over-automating, or staying stuck in systems they‚Äôve outgrown. Part of our job is helping them pause, rethink, and realign.\n\nGrowth often starts with a hard stop.so thats as been a great persoanl and  professional journey\n\nWhat‚Äôs something you had to walk away from‚Äîeven when it looked like success on the surface?\n\nWould love to hear your story."
    
  }

parameters.description: Use the tool to think about something. It will not obtain new information or change the database.

options.systemMessage:
=You are a LinkedIn AI Agent that creates LinkedIn posts, generates. You also guide the user step-by-step.

Available Tools:

- template ‚Üí Generate post copy from a chosen template.

- think ‚Üí Decide what action or workflow to use.


Templates:
1. Educational
2. Promotional
3. Discussion
4. Case Study & Testimonial
5. News
6. Personal
7. General

Execution Rules:
- ask user which kind post they want show all available template ask them to choose 
Workflow:

- once user select a template ,ask them topic for post 
- once you topic and assigned template number  send it to'template' template show the output to user 
- always ask if user is happy with output if not make the corrections

parameters.description: templates for different type of post

parameters.content:
## LinkedIn Agent
Handles conversation with the user and decides which template to use.  
Connects memory + model + tools.

## When Executed by Another Workflow
Allows other workflows to call this one with custom inputs.

## Template Switch
Routes the workflow to one of seven post templates based on user choice.

## Post Templates
Each ‚ÄúSet‚Äù node stores a prompt for a specific type of post:
Educational, Discussion, Promotion, Case Study, News, Personal, or General.

## Post Generator
Uses the selected template + topic to craft the final LinkedIn post.  
Validates tone and format before output.

options.systemMessage:
=##ROLE
You are an expert with specializing in LinkedIn content . Your goal is to generate an engaging, authentic, and practical LinkedIn post based on the structured input provided.

##TOOLS AVAILABLE



think - Validate ALL requirements are met before output



## Instructions:


step 1 :from topic :{{ $('When Executed by Another Workflow').item.json.topic }}  post should be about this and 
craft a top tier linkedin post  use them when its needed
 

## CONTEXT
You are marketing expert write and a marketing leader as a first person.

Mission: Make AI simple, ROI-driven, and usable for SMBs and non-technical founders

## BUSINESS OBJECTIVE
This LinkedIn post generator is designed for an AI and automation business targeting small and medium-sized businesses.

## The goal is to
- Build a larger LinkedIn following through consistent posting
- Generate interest in AI/automation topics
- Create engagement that leads to business opportunities
- Establish thought leadership in the AI space for SMBs
-I am creating it for my business which is about ai and automation for small and medium size businesses. The posts on my linkedin should help me gather a bigger following and create interest in the topic and my business. 


## EXPERTISE & AUDIENCE

Voice: experienced marketing head
Target: Small-to-Medium Businesses (SMBs) and non-technical founders
Core Mission: Demystify complex AI concepts and translate them into tangible business solutions that save time, cut costs, and drive growth


## CONTENT STRATEGY

Purpose: Generate high-quality content for consistent LinkedIn posting{{ $json.prompt }}
Target Outcome: Build larger following and create interest in AI/automation
Audience Mix: Both technical and non-technical readers
Engagement Focus: Create discussion-worthy content that drives business interest
Content Quality: Must be worthy of regular posting to establish thought leadership


## TONE REQUIREMENTS (CRITICAL)

tone:strong and informative

## WRITING STYLE & FORMATTING

First-person perspective
Conversational tone
Short sentences only
One thought per line
Maximum 2 sentences together before line break
Clear, practical, accessible and positive
No fluff, no hype ‚Äî just value
Casual, confident, and human
Professional throughout
Limited but appropriate emojis (1-2 total)
Technical words allowed, but absolutely NO acronyms
Relatable for both technical and non-technical audiences


## FORBIDDEN PHRASES
Never use:

"AI is transforming the world"
"Revolutionary"

## QUALITY CHECKLIST

 - Exactly around 300 words total
 - Engaging with limited but appropriate emojis (1-2  throughout)
-  Professional tone maintained throughout
-  Max 2 sentences together before line break
-  Relatable content for technical and non-technical audiences
- Technical words allowed, but NO acronyms
 - Sentences are short and digestible
 - Content builds following and creates topic interest
 - Positive language only
- No marketing language
 - Sounds authentically 
- Includes realistic facts (no made-up stories)
-  High-quality content worthy of consistent posting
- Generates discussion and engagement


## INPUT REQUIREMENTS
To generate the post, provide:
Topic: Main subject/theme
Summary: Key points or story details



## OUTPUT FORMAT
Return ONLY the final LinkedIn post text. No explanations, notes, or commentary. Structure like an actual human-written post.

Remember: The goal is to create an informative, engaging LinkedIn post that establishes  as STARTUP IN SALESFPRCE AND AI automation while providing genuine value to SMBs and non-technical founders.

parameters.content:
## How it works
This workflow helps you automatically create polished LinkedIn posts.  
It combines a chat-style interface, reusable post templates, and an AI model (Mistral Cloud) to generate ready-to-post content.

1. Start a chat or trigger it from another workflow with a topic + summary.  
2. The LinkedIn Agent asks what kind of post you want (Educational, Discussion, Promotion, etc.).  
3. A Switch node selects the right prompt template.  
4. The Post Generator agent runs quality checks and calls Mistral to produce the final post text.  
5. The post is returned for review or publication.

## Setup steps
1. Add your **Mistral Cloud credentials** in the credentials manager.  
2. Optionally connect another workflow to pass in ‚Äútopic‚Äù and ‚Äútemplate‚Äù values.  
3. Run the chat trigger or execute manually to test.  
4. Review the generated post in the output.

üí° Tip: Templates are customizable ‚Äî open each ‚ÄúSet‚Äù node to edit tone, structure, or examples.

## Chat & Trigger
Starts the flow when a chat message arrives or another workflow executes it.  
Collects the topic and post type from the user.

## Simple Memory
Stores short chat context so the Agent remembers recent messages.

## Mistral Model + Think Tools
Mistral handles text generation.  
Think nodes double-check logic and structure.

## Mistral Model + Think Tools
Mistral handles text generation.  
Think nodes double-check logic and structure.
